intro: Tomophyllum millefolium, commonly known as the common yarrow, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its feathery, fern-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun. It has a taproot system and is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to ecological biodiversity.
